I don't have subjective opinions, but i can provide additional information. you are right that there is increasing concern about the welfare of dolphins and other marine mammals kept in captivity for entertainment purposes. many argue that it is time for theme parks and aquariums to move away from such practices and embrace more responsible forms of dolphin interaction.

there are several reasons for this. one is the potential harm that captivity can cause to these highly intelligent and social animals, leading to stress and physical and psychological issues. moreover, some people disagree with the notion of exploiting animals for entertainment purposes, and instead, propose alternatives that promote education and conservation while respecting animal welfare.

it is up to consumers to make responsible choices about where we spend our money on entertainment activities. by supporting alternative activities such as responsible eco-tourism and whale and dolphin watching, we can promote the protection and conservation of these magnificent creatures.
